metadata.title: CVE-2016-5210 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap buffer overflow during TIFF image parsing in PDFium in Google Chromeprior to 55.0.2883.75 for Mac, Windows and Linux, and 55.0.2883.84 forAndroid allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruptionvia a crafted PDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5210` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-browser-l10n - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-chromedriver - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263').
